title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: The Trump administration says some approved childhood vaccines need better studies. Scientists disagree
items.description: Rationale for dropping some vaccine recommendations faces skepticism

items.title: How some people get drunk from their own gut bacteria
items.description: Largest study so far of people with the rare “autobrewery syndrome” points to more culprit microbes

items.title: Ex–Google CEO funds private space telescope bigger than Hubble
items.description: Schmidt Sciences announces investments in orbiting observatory and three ground-based instruments

items.title: Why does Denmark recommend so few childhood vaccines? A Danish scientist explains
items.description: The U.S. plans to follow the Scandinavian country’s minimalist schedule. That may be a mistake, Jens Lundgren says

items.title: Alzheimer’s drug developers accuse clinical trial sites of faking data
items.description: T3D Therapeutics alleges that contract researchers delivered “medically impossible” results on its candidate drug

items.title: Fossils point to common ancestor of modern humans, Neanderthals
items.description: Bones from a Moroccan quarry belonged to a hominin that lived when the human lineage was splitting

items.title: Why a fatal ‘black fungus’ struck India during the COVID-19 pandemic
items.description: Mucormycosis may be triggered by low levels of albumin, the most common blood protein

items.title: NASA’s Mars Sample Return mission is dead
items.description: Congress backs Trump administration’s efforts to kill project that would ferry martian rocks to Earth

items.title: Fresh conflicts erupt around giant database for flu and COVID-19 sequences
items.description: Critics say “autocratic” behavior by GISAID could hamper response to a future pandemic

items.title: Appeals court agrees that NIH cannot reduce overhead payments to academic institutions
items.description: Judges uphold injunction by lower court against a 15% flat rate for indirect costs
